attributes.action: Sell the Palace of Westminster. MPs to vote on where to relocate Parliament.
attributes.background: The iconic Houses of Parliament are in urgent need of repair. Moving parliament to a modern purpose built site would create much needed economic stimulus elsewhere in the UK. The existing Palace of Westminster would prove to be a popular tourist attraction.
attributes.additional_details: The Scottish Parliament and The Welsh Assembly have modern buildings, purpose built in the twenty first century. The Houses of Parliament which serve the whole of the UK were built in the nineteenth century. Repairing the structure while the day to day business of Parliament continues there, would be difficult and expensive. Our MPs deserve modern facilities. Once the new location has been selected and the new venue created, the Palace of Westminster could be sold off to be properly restored.

attributes.action: Bring back the Emerging Personality Disorder Unit in Somerset Areas
attributes.background:
The Emerging Personality Disorder team help many young adults who are diagnosed with Emerging Personality Disorders.
 A Personality Disorder is a type of mental illness that affects a persons behaviours and thoughts.
 The team in Somerset and surrounding areas has been cut.
attributes.additional_details: This team is key to many young adults recovery.

attributes.action: Allow vulnerable, unaccompanied minors into the UK
attributes.background:
Medical volunteers helping in Calais report they have treated 7 boys aged between 14 & 16 in the past six months who claimed to have been raped. All had injuries consistent with these claims. 
We call on the British government to ease the path of entry to minors with legitimate claims to asylum.
attributes.additional_details:
There are over 400 unaccompanied children in the Calais Jungle and tens of thousands across the continent. They are the most vulnerable of the vulnerable. They have travelled hundreds of miles without the protection of adults or families.
Many have relatives in the UK and a legitimate claim to enter the country. 
In January, a senior representative of Europol estimated that 10,000 unaccompanied children had gone missing within Europe.

attributes.action: Stop undue Government interference in Local Government Pension Fund investment.
attributes.background:
Pension fund regulation should ensure responsible investment decisions to pay pension benefits. 
The Government are proposing to direct investment policies of Local Government Pension Funds, surpassing Uk pension fund Investment Regulations.This may not be in the best interest of scheme members.
attributes.additional_details:
References
Paper by the Department for Communities and Local Government entitled Investment Reform Criteria and Guidance. November 2015

attributes.action: Campaign to keep the Mersey bridges toll free.
attributes.background:
In autumn 2017 a new six-lane bridge over the Mersey between Runcorn and Widnes will open to assist the neighbouring Silver Jubilee Bridge.

Both the new Mersey Gateway Bridge and the historically free existing Jubilee Bridge will be heavily tolled.
attributes.additional_details:
The tolls are unfair and will penalise workers, residents, businesses and visitors as well as create a new "North - South Divide". It will also be an unwanted "City Tax" on Liverpool for visitors and tourists.

Businesses who operate vehicles (like taxi's, minibuses, PSV, LGV and HGV operators) who need to cross the Mersey for their normal course of duty (often many times per day) will be financially discriminated against and secure an unfair competitive advantage to others through no fault of their own.

WE MUST STAND UP FOR WHAT IS RIGHT AND FAIR TO ALL AND FIGHT AGAINST THESE TOLLS!

attributes.action: Require that all new build properties be fitted with solar PV panels at build.
attributes.background: Solar (PV) power as an important and easily achieved form of renewable energy. PV panels fitted at build keeps costs low, helping to reduce the need for large power generation such as at Hinkley Point. New battery storage systems mean this power would be available even after sundown.

attributes.action: Introduce Politics into the Key Stage 3 & 4 curriculum
attributes.background: We believe that politics should be an evenly taught subject with the objective to inform learners of what policies the current government have in place and the effect these can have on the country. Also to avoid being mislead by any inaccurate advertising by any campaign.
attributes.additional_details: "£350 million a week goes to the EU, let's put that into the NHS" - Misleading to those without an understanding of what the £350 million actually goes on.

attributes.action: Reinstate the 2006 plan for all new homes built after 2016 to be zero carbon.
attributes.background: The plan would have ensured that all new dwellings from 2016 would generate as much energy on-site – via renewable sources, e.g. wind or solar energy – as they would use in heating, hot water, lighting and ventilation. This would be alongside tighter energy efficiency standards.
attributes.additional_details:
Zero Carbon homes are not more expensive - designers at Cardiff University built a zero carbon house at no extra cost here: (http://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-33544831). Also, they will be cheaper to run as energy costs could be zero or even negative, therefore earning the owners money.
As well as the economic benefits of zero carbon homes, reducing carbon emissions is also important for climate change; and reducing energy dependency on other countries (i.e. by importing gas and oil)

attributes.action: Make government responses to petitions more productive.
attributes.background: The responses to petitions started online more often than not simply sustain that "the government is confident it has made the right decision." This is hugely counter-productive in easing the public's concerns over government actions.
attributes.additional_details:
Given that a petition gains the appropriate number of signatures to be responded to, it is clear that a large number of people disagree that the government has made the right decision, and reiterating this statement without any due consideration for why or where the concerns are coming from defeats the object of having this platform for petitions. 
Concerns must be understood and responded to with possible courses of action to improve the situation brought to attention by the petitions.

attributes.action: To create a maximum working environment temperature.
attributes.background: Working in conditions that are too hot can become counter productive and can mean that staff cannot fully function and work to their best capacity.

attributes.action: make it  compulsory  to  neuter  after  1st litter  in dogs
attributes.background: please   help   these  rescue    reduce   being overun     by  making it  legal  all  owners  spay  after  first  litter
attributes.additional_details: we   the public  would  love  to  see a law    , that all  breeders   are  made  to  neuter  dogs  after  1st  litter  ,  and a law against  any breeder  cross breeding pedigree  dogs    ,  rescues  over  run  already and lots being  pts  as cant  be rehomed  , these   owners cross  breeding  for   cockapoo  etc  are adding  to  it

attributes.action: Manditory detainment for persons arrested on suspicion of terrorism - no bail
attributes.background: In light of the current severe threat of terrorism in the UK and throughout the world, any individual arrested on suspicion of terrorist offences should be denied bail pending enquiries, charges and trial as they pose a genuine flight risk thus putting lives of the general public at greater risk.

attributes.action: Ensure road cyclists pay a tax and adhere to a DVLA type set of rules
attributes.background:
Taxing cyclists who are over the age of 18 £30 a year would generate £130m+ per year which can be used for cycle lane projects and improving the roads.

With this tax, cyclists should also be made to followe a DVLA type set of rules when on the roads.
attributes.additional_details:
The tax would generate over £130m+ a year which could be used to improve roads for cyclalcists and help with cycle lane projects.

The DVLA type rules would also help reduce the amount of road accidents involving cyclists. Currently 48% of all cyclists feel unsafe when out on the roads. These new rules will help both cyclists and other road users make better choices when it comes to scenarios involving cyclists.

Do the right thing for Britain - sign this petition.

attributes.action: Stop lobbying by means of political donation
attributes.background: It is about time that political lobbying is made both clearer and less open to abuse. Let's fund political parties out of public money only and end the opportunity for political lobbying via donations. Take lobbying by means of political donation out of the equation and there'd be a lot less sleaze.
attributes.additional_details: All political parties should be funded via a mechanism similar to short money which should be shared equally to all political parties that achieve a minimum number of members who agree to follow the Electoral Commission rules.

attributes.action: Consider having judge & jury in family courts for adoption matters.
attributes.background: Through personal experience I feel strongly that family courts when dealing with adoption cases should be judge & jury. The reason being that in some genuine cases such as mine where someone without very little family support often get's unheard and treated unfairly.

attributes.action: David Cameron to apologise over his irrelevant comments towards Jeremy Corbyn
attributes.background: For too long David Cameron and his backbenchers have used their time in the house of commons avoiding questions, and slandering Jeremy Corbyn's appearance and rudely speaking and jeering over a man the majority of labour supports elected into power.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for insurance companies to penalise victims of crime
attributes.background:
As a victim of more than eight hit & run accidents against our motor vehicle in four years, of which five were reported to the police with no action other than receiving a crime number.

We have now been declined renewal on our motor insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
It is criminal that insurance companies can be allowed to impose punitive action against innocent victims of crime.

Our justice system and British values are built on innocent until proven guilty and punishing perpetrators of crime not the victims.

It is quite clear the Financial Conduct Authority is incapable of regulating the insurance industry and ensuring ethical behavior is enshrined into the financial sector and so we must pass laws to stop this diabolical behavior.

attributes.action: Cancel plans for a new "Death Tax".  Probate should be the same for all.
attributes.background: The work that the Probate Registry does is the same whatever the value of the estate. There is no excuse to introduce this extortionate, banded tax. Taxing already-taxed money is offensive enough. The Conservative manifesto promised to decrease Inheritance Tax, NOT raise it through a back door.
attributes.additional_details:
The amount of money it is planned to raise through this tax is a relative pittance to the UK Government, but to individuals, it will be a fortune to the bereaved and the executors. 

Even IHT is one of the UK's least efficient taxes.  

If the government cannot balance the budget, the Chancellor must start collecting the billions hidden by large multi-national corporations, and not making some side agreement with these CFOs via a dodgy handshake.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum in England on maintaining the ban on hunting foxes with hounds
attributes.background: The hunting of foxes is a controversial issue which should be decided by the whole electorate. This petition calls upon HM Government to hold a referendum in England to establish whether or not the English electorate believes that the ban on hunting foxes with hounds should be upheld and maintained.

attributes.action: Change rules for working Carers to hours worked, instead of £110 per week.
attributes.background: At the moment the rules for receiving Carer's Allowance states that you cannot earn more than £110 per week. If the government changed the rules to specify someone in receipt of CA can only work a certain number of hours instead it would be a lot more fair.
attributes.additional_details:
£110 divided by £7.20 (minimum wage) = 15 hours (approx)
£110 divided by £9.50 = 11.5 hours (approx)
Therefore someone on a lower wage is clearly disadvantaged, because they have to work longer hours to earn the weekly allowance.  This then means that the disabled person is disadvantaged by not having their carer present.

If the rules state you can work 15 hours it would be much fairer to all carers.

https://www.gov.uk/national-minimum-wage-rates
https://www.gov.uk/carers-allowance/eligibility

attributes.action: Raise awareness and increase funding for Mental Health.
attributes.background: Mental Health is a significant issue in the UK. Around 25% of all UK citizens experience mental illness, and almost a third of children in education will experience it. It is a silent issue that many feel embarrassed to discuss. Our aim is to raise support for those who experience mental illness.
attributes.additional_details: We (National Citizen Service) are currently aiming to work in association with a charity called 'Mind' who are currently supporting around 375,000 people, which is drastically less than the 25% that come forward regarding their mental illness.

attributes.action: To make food banks a legal obligation for all supermarkets in the UK.
attributes.background: Food banks play a big part in helping the homeless. Fortunately, some supermarkets have food banks, however there are still many large supermarkets who don't. We want to make a change, and make it policy that all supermarkets provide food banks to give back to the community.
attributes.additional_details: It costs nothing for supermarkets to provide this service, however it will make a huge difference to those in the community who need it.

attributes.action: Stop children convicted of serious offences from attending mainstream schools
attributes.background: The current legislative framework MUST be reviewed to ensure those committing the most serious offences such as stabbing another child cannot return to mainstream school, putting the safety of children & teachers at risk
attributes.additional_details: There MUST be a minimum period of monitoring and psychological assessment within a specialist unit before offenders are reintegrated, irrespective of the number of previous exclusions a child has.  Disruptive behaviour currently carries the same punishment as stabbing.

attributes.action: Create special funding for the victims of racial hatred & bigotry postreferendum
attributes.background: After the brexit referendum was won, there has been a nasty upsurge in racial attacks & xenophobia in general.  We need to create special funding for the victims of this vile abuse, whether it be for counselling or repairs, whatever their needs. Also we need to ensure police resources to combat it.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-devon-36737529
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/eu-referendum-racism_uk_576fe161e4b08d2c56396075
https://secure.avaaz.org/en/petition/MPs_also_the_PM_David_Cameron_Provide_additional_funding_for_victims_of_hate_crimes/edit/

insurmountable evidence that there was was a latent problem & this referendum result has validated these bigot. So now we need to help drive it down into the cracks & crevices again.

attributes.action: All plastic packaging produced by supermarkets must be made to be recyclable
attributes.background: There is an inordinate amount of plastic produced by supermarkets.  At least 50% of this shows that it is not recyclable. So much plastic is being put into bins and then into landfill. Individuals are responsible for recycling but given the opportunity to recycle more I think most will.

attributes.action: Permit a one off national holiday celebrating immigrants and their contributions
attributes.background: In light of recent doubts raised across multiple spectrums about the benefits of immigration we believe it is time for immigrants to reveal their true value the country. By staging a single one off strike/national holiday the impact of the U.K. without immigrants might be better understood.

attributes.action: Implement RSPCA approved standards to all UK livestock farms
attributes.background: We must keep adhering to the 5 Freedoms. EU standards require animals to be inspected once a day, sow stalls are still used for the first 4 weeks of pregnancy, meat chickens have avg. 7cm of space (33kg per m² avg. weight 2.4kg), 550cm² for egg laying hens, calves are only put into groups at 8 weeks
attributes.additional_details:
RSPCA welfare standards should be implemented as the standard practice: http://science.rspca.org.uk/sciencegroup/farmanimals/standards
EU law: 
http://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/3818623/eu-law-on-the-welfare-of-farm-animals.pdf
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/animal-welfare#on-farm-animal-welfare

If we can't improve our standards to RSPCA level, it is paramount these animals do not have to endure any more suffering than they already do under EU law. Ideal: CCTV in livestock farms for RSPCA to access

attributes.action:
If the UK votes leave and London votes IN,
London should become Independent.
attributes.background: Polls suggest that London will vote in favour of remaining in the EU. Scotland is already planning to leave Great Britain in order to remain in the EU, if Britain votes to leave. London should have the opportunity to do the same. Its population is larger than many EU states.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.standard.co.uk/news/london/eu-referendum-london-backs-remain-vote-poll-shows-a3256001.html

attributes.action: Park Home residents should have the legal right to install water sub-meters.
attributes.background: All homes on our park pay an equal amount.  There are single and double occupied homes.  Many residents spend weeks or months away from their homes for different reasons, holidays, hospital stays etc.  Water leakage from the one meter on the park to the homes is included in the total bill.

attributes.action: Replace the Human Rights Act with a UK Bill of Rights
attributes.background: We need to scrap the European Human Rights directives implementation in the UK and replace it with a UK Bill of Rights.
attributes.additional_details:
The Human Rights which the British government helped create has become a joke and we have lost control of the UK's criminal system, unable to deport people who actively want to harm British citizens back to their home countries.

We need a bill of rights that protects the British people.

attributes.action: Introduce a Singapore style additional stamp duty for overseas buyers in London.
attributes.background:
London's painful housing crisis is being exacerbated by Foreign Investors using the city's property market as a shelter for 
dirty money.

The government of Singapore responded to similar speculation by introducing an additional 15% tax on foreign purchasers in the city state.
attributes.additional_details:
Research by Knight Frank shows in Prime Central London 49% of sales go to overseas buyers, while in inner London the figure is 20%.

'Buy-to-Leave' investment has irreversibly changed many of London's most famous neighborhoods, with whole streets of 'ghost houses'.

The weakness of the global economy and instability in traditional investments if making the problem worse; as the global wealthy look for a safe parking place for their money.

attributes.action: Parliament debates the legality of EU treaties with regard to Vienna Convention.
attributes.background:
Article 53, Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties: 1969 states:  'A treaty is void if, at the time of its conclusion, it conflicts with a peremptory norm of general international law.'  

Peremptory norm includes the removal of sovereignty and the removal of law not specifically repealed.
attributes.additional_details:
It is recognised that EU Treaties entail removal of National Sovereignty and abrogate National Law not specifically repealed which includes the Treason Laws.   Parliament is sovereign except that it shall not diminish its own sovereignty.

As Parliament at various times has seen fit to transfer sovereignty to the EU, it is illegal under International Law and should cease forthwith including any procedures laid down by the EU for secession from the EU and withdraw unilaterally,

attributes.action: Make assisted suicide for terminally ill patients legal
attributes.background:
As a veterinary surgeon I have euthansed many animals and consider it an honour and priviledge to have been able to end their suffering and give them a swift and painless end. 
At aged 47 I was diagnosed with breast cancer, and despite it being caught early 18 months later it is now terminal
attributes.additional_details:
The argument against assisted suicide seems to be that people could be coerced into taking their own lives. Frankly if other countries can put in measures to reduce this possibility, I cannot think it is beyond us. To die, at a time of ones choosing, painlessly and with loved ones around you is surely what we all wish for.
 My situation is far from unique and 1000's of people are condemoned 
to an end of pain and suffering which could so easily be avoided. Is this not what true compassion is?

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for recreational use by over 16s
attributes.background: Cannabis has been a Class B drug in the UK since 2009, meaning that it's illegal to sell, distribute, or use the drug in any way. However, millions of people throughout the UK still take advantage of cannabis for their recreational use, often turning to backstreet dealers who are making thousands.
attributes.additional_details:
If cannabis was commercially available in UK pharmacies & supermarkets, not only would British businesses profit massively, but the VAT attached would make millions of pounds for the UK economy, which could be spent on things such as a better-funded NHS & more modern facilities for our schools. 

Cannabis has often been branded as bad for one's health, when in reality, it often soothes anxiety; prevents glaucoma; and doesn't have a harmful effect on your organs like tobacco & alcohol can.

attributes.action: Compulsory dyslexia tests in schools
attributes.background: At the moment there aren't compulsory tests for dyslexia in primary schools so thousands of children struggle through their school life without knowing that they have it. This needs to change so that they can receive support and advice to help them.

attributes.action: Support the provision of new bomb detection equipment to Baghdad checkpoints.
attributes.background: On the 2nd of July, 165 innocent Iraqis were killed in the Karrada district of Baghdad in a massive explosion near a shopping mall by car bomb- a truck to be precise.  Another car bomb explosion took the lives of around 100 innocent shoppers at a market in Baghdad a month before. The list is long.
attributes.additional_details: There are many Checkpoints in Baghdad. Police are still using fake bomb detectors bought via a bogus British businessman who was jailed in the UK over the deal 3 years ago. Iraqi Prime minister called for an end to their use. It is frustrating to see that so many innocent lives could be saved using modern security technologies, which the UK is a world leader in. I call on the British government to openly support the Iraqi authority in replacing bomb detection equipment at checkpoints.

attributes.action: Create a system in which breached child contact orders can be enforced quickly
attributes.background: Parents are being ripped away from their children for months after a separation while they await a court hearing. They spend thousands to get a court order which, if breached, has to be brought to court to be enforced. The wronged parent incurs all costs and is again seperated from his/her children.
attributes.additional_details: The parent breaching the court order is breaking the law yet it is the other parent, and the children, who suffer. It can take 4 months to get a date for the original order to be enforced which is unacceptable. The parent breaching the court order should be forced to pay all costs and this process should take a maximum of, for example, 30 days. This will minimise the emotional impact on the children and parents whilst reducing the occurance of breached orders.

attributes.action: Manchester & other pro-EU cities to become independent EU member city states
attributes.background:
Manchester, Liverpool, Leeds, London, etc... We didnt vote to leave the EU. We want to protections that EU membership offers in terms of workers rights, human rights, and environmental legislation. 
We want to secede from the UK & remain in the EU, operating as a network of independent city states.
attributes.additional_details:
The cities that voted to remain in the EU have a long history of welcoming migrants and of fighting for progressive values. We want to continue to enjoy the benefits of EU membership whilst also fighting for a better Europe. 

With devolution already on the agenda, our cities could operate as networked city-states with EU membership. We should hold local referenda on seceding from the UK and remaining in the EU.

attributes.action: Only one councillor should represent a ward in the local councils.
attributes.background: Derbyshire PCC Mr Hardayal Dhindsa is a local councillor as well. PCC role is quite demanding and a full time position, still Mr Dhindsa decided to continue as a Councillor. This shows that three councillors aren't needed to represent a ward specially when in Sandwell 71 out of 72 are from Labour.
attributes.additional_details: In Derby there are total of 17 wards and every ward has 3 councillors. Interestingly if all three are from the same party then it becomes quite pointless to have them. There is no job description and position doesn't have any accountability. One tory councillor kept on getting paid while he lived abroad. Also councils like Sandwell only have Labour councillors and that has been the case for ages. Local democracy is failing and need urgent reforms.

attributes.action: Stop Government wrecking our Free BBC. Leave our BBC alone.
attributes.background: Government intend to draw up new proposals for a 'radical overhaul' in how the BBC is governed & audited. Currently the government hands over our licence fee monies in order to pay for our beloved BBC. In recent years there have been drastic cuts & reshaping but these new measures are very worrying.
attributes.additional_details: This is a totalitarian tactic damaging the impartiality of the BBC. The BBC is the only juggernaut working on behalf of the public with everyone's interests at heart. It's possible that if we allow government to rip the heart out of this organisation then, eventually, there will be very little truth being broadcast to the population. We cannot rely on the newspapers alone as they don't belong to us, & b) Many, including The Daily Mail & the Sun are owned by people such as Rupert Murdoch

attributes.action: Link all public sector salaries to MPs' salaries (Backdated to April 2014)
attributes.background: Since April 2014, MPs' salaries have increased by 10.3%, whereas most  working in the public sector have seen salary stagnation. The goal of this petition is to link the increase of public sector salaries with MPs' salaries both backdated to April 2014 and in the future.

attributes.action: Save West Cumberland Hospital
attributes.background: West Cumberland Hospital serves the West of the county of Cumbria. Assets are being stripped from the hospital in favour of "specialising" in a PFI hospital in Carlisle. If assets such as A&E, consultant led Midwifery and Paediatrics are removed we are in serious danger.
attributes.additional_details: The nearest hospital is the PFI Cumberland Infirmary in Carlisle, some 40 miles from Whitehaven. Owing to the rural spread and coverage of WCH we need to keep it. Please see Jamie Reed MP for further details.

attributes.action: Stop forced adoption. It's destroying families, our children are not your profit
attributes.background: We need a full investigation on how SS work taking children from their mum when no acutal harm has come to their child, however they say that there 'could be potential harm'. It costs more to adopt out then to keep the baby with the mother, something needs to be done, our children are at risk.
attributes.additional_details: forced adoption happens in secret family courts, a council are given a target to meet on how many babies/children they need to adopt to get bonuses. John hemming, a known mp who knows all about this matter and sees the doings. Understandingly I know ss have the duty of care to a child I don't disputes that but ever since baby p (bless hes soul) mothers that wouldn't put their babies at harm are paying the price or living the consequences of how you had a bad up bringing

attributes.action: Exempt self employed subbies from Class 4 national insurance contributions.
attributes.background: From 2015, self employed people have to pay 9% national insurance on all profits over £8000 which brings your total yearly tax up to near a whopping 29% per year. Previously self employed people only had to pay a rate of £2.80 per week class 2 national insurance as they were not directly employed.

attributes.action: Move the Westminster Government at least 100 miles further North, permanently.
attributes.background: Moving the seat of government out of the UK's richest enclave would make MPs think differently about all of the country.  It would put thousands of highly-paid supporting jobs where costs are lower and whose local economy would benefit from a boost, and impact London House prices favourably.
attributes.additional_details:
Presently even the leadership of the Northern Powerhouse is 97% in London (Guardian, 7/3/16).

The forthcoming, very costly refurbishment means the Westminster government will need at least a temporary home. Other worthy petitions call for it to be 'outside London'. This one calls for permanent relocation, a clear and 'pychological' distance to the North of London. The physical Houses of Parliament could be refurbished with a view to some other use.

attributes.action: Stop or rethink the current pet passport system and bring back quarantine laws
attributes.background:
Following the recent case of babesiosis in Essex where two dogs have been destroyed I call for a review on the transportation and movement of domestic animal to and from our country.
I propose that quarantine restrictions are reinstated so that disease and illness is not missed in incubation period
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has previously been free of Babesiosis, Rabies and other disease and viruses found on the continent. Its my view it should stay this way especially due to our dense population and the risk of major outbreak is high. Take foot and mouth disease as an example of just how prolific the spread of disease can be and that only affected a controlled animal population.
We have put our borders in a situation that bring much avoidable risk and has allowed easy movement of puppies and stolen pets

attributes.action: Reinstate the state pension age to 65 for all and stop future age increases
attributes.background: When i started work we were told 65 was your retirement age now their moving this all the time with sucsessive reviews every few years this needs to stop now I like many others cannot retire without the state pension we need to make a stand

attributes.action: Require at least 80% of MPs to attend debates held as a result of a petition
attributes.background: The British government implemented an official petition system to hear the needs of the people. However, it is failing its purpose: petitions reaching 100,000 signatures are debated, but often by a very small number of attending MPs. This must change to force the government to hear our wishes.
attributes.additional_details:
The petition to "accept more asylum seekers and increase support for refugee migrants in the UK" was signed by over 450,000 citizens, but only 27 MPs turned up to debate.

The petition to "make the production, sale and use of cannabis legal" received almost 250,000 signatures, yet even fewer of our elected MPs turned up to debate.

The petition system in its current form is a method for the government to systematically ignore the wishes of the electorate. This needs to change.

attributes.action: Mandatory life sentence for anyone caught committing a Terror attack
attributes.background: In the light of recent terror attacks across the EU and the lenient prison sentences these individuals receive. We would like the law changed so that anyone committing or planning a terror attack, joining terror group and their accomplices receive a mandatory life sentence of no less than 25 years
attributes.additional_details: Recent terror attack in France saw a Priest beheaded by an individual recently released from Prison. He served a light sentence for trying to join an ISIS group in Syria. These people would of been safe if these individual had been jailed for life.

attributes.action: Make an allowance for children with social challenges to have term time holiday
attributes.background: Children on the autistic spectrum for instance can find being around others difficult, it can be overwhelming and make them very uncomfortable. They often need more space and time to adjust and process and they ought to have the opportunity for a relaxing holiday, like any one else.
attributes.additional_details: Term time holidays would allow for a quieter environment, more physical and mental space, slower / calmer interactions with people, less stress caused by social situations, less queuing, less waiting, a break from peers, the result being a calmer and more relaxed child and therefore family.
